entities.name: bill
entities.description: Bill is mentioned as one of the people having breakfast with Mrs. Weasley, described in the text as 'ﬁnishing their breakfasts'.

entities.name: monsieur delacour
entities.description: Monsieur Delacour is mentioned as one of the people having breakfast with Mrs. Weasley, described in the text as 'ﬁnishing their breakfasts'.

entities.name: mrs weasley
entities.description: Mrs. Weasley is mentioned as chatting to Bill and Monsieur Delacour over the frying pan, described in the text as 'stood chatting to them over the frying pan'.

entities.name: arthur weasley
entities.description: Arthur Weasley is mentioned as having left for work early, but will be back for dinner, described in the text as 'He had to leave early for work, but he’ll be back for dinner'.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as receiving a present from Mrs. Weasley, described in the text as '“Arthur told me to wish you a happy seventeenth, Harry,”'.

entities.name: ron weasley
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as having received a watch from Mr. and Mrs. Weasley for his seventeenth birthday, described in the text as 'the one Mr. and Mrs. Weasley had given Ron for his seventeenth'.

entities.name: fabian weasley
entities.description: Fabian is mentioned as the previous owner of the watch, described in the text as 'it was actually my brother Fabian’s'.

relationships.description: Mrs. Weasley is chatting to Bill over the frying pan, described in the text as 'stood chatting to them over the frying pan'.
Mrs. Weasley is chatting to Monsieur Delacour over the frying pan, described in the text as 'stood chatting to them over the frying pan'.
Arthur Weasley sent a present to Harry, described in the text as '“Arthur told me to wish you a happy seventeenth, Harry,”'.
Mr. Weasley gave a watch to Ron for his seventeenth birthday, described in the text as 'the one Mr. and Mrs. Weasley had given Ron for his seventeenth'.
Fabian's watch was given to Harry, described in the text as 'it was actually my brother Fabian’s'.
